Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: adding seeds through bean browser doesn't
 work in heritrix 3.3 snapshot
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=aUDM0oL3r0Y8me9EEL54tP13f0KPKbdw9vkT9LpuyzkD
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo
From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>

Both the 'bean browser' and 'scripting console' are essentially 
Java-expert level tools to allow fancy mid-crawl changes or debugging. 
To use most effectively, understanding the source code is required.

Some configuration values are only consulted during the initial 
build/launch of a crawl, then either wouldn't make sense to change, or 
might be very inefficient to change. Others are consulted every time 
they're needed. Unfortunately only reading the source and understanding 
the crawler's internals can distinguish those two.

In particular, you *can* edit the MatchesRegexDecideRule 'regex' 
property and it will take effect mid-crawl. (I can tell this is the case 
because at 
<https://github.com/internetarchive/heritrix3/blob/master/modules/src/main/java/org/archive/modules/deciderules/MatchesRegexDecideRule.java#L61>, 
the evaluate method that I know is called each time a URI is tested, 
asks for the property value via getRegex every time.)

Note, though, that an mid-crawl edit *won't* change your configuration 
file on-disk (the "CXML").

- Gordon

On 6/24/14, 10:58 PM, src_psu@... [archive-crawler] wrote:
>
>
> Sorry but I don't quite understand the meaning of "something that
> requires some action to take effect". Let's say I want to change a value
> in crawl scope (by changing a previously written
> MatchesRegexDecideRule). Will that change make any effect? If changing
> values through "browse beans/scripting console" do not make any change
> mid-crawl, what is their utility?
>
>
>
>
